channel.title: Easy Cash
channel.description:
It's a free 25$ for signing up, and 10$ for every person you refer. Short surveys with no redirects. Only one issue so far, I'm not sure how to payout.
[url=http://www.paybox.me/r/reyx7]http://www.paybox.me/r/reyx7[/url] Or, if you don't want me to be $10 richer, [url=http://www.paybox.me]http://www.paybox.me[/url]
If you can find out how to get a payout of the cash, POST!!!!

item.title: Easy Cash
item.dc:creator: @Javafire Javafire
item.description:
@Javafire wrote:

[quote=“casey., post:24, topic:371833”]I hope you realize that your not getting any of that money in real life.

Their dollar system=point system, so it could be something like 100,000 points for 10$ item.
Though nothing lost, you probably have no life so it’s not like you wasted your life when you could of been doing other things.[/quote]

they also try to extract personal information through the advertisements but however the fact 90% of people most likely use false info is basically no cause for concern, it is basically as said, a big fat fucking waste of my damn valuable time bitches… -.-

Read full topic

item.title: Easy Cash
item.dc:creator: @reyx7 reyx7
item.description:
@reyx7 wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”][url=http://www.paybox.me/r/ivaini]PayBox doesn’t currently offer payout.

It’s still in the EarlyBird stage, which could be considered alpha.

They have considered to start giving out PayBox account cards, which can be used such as most any debit/credit cards. Though, they haven’t finished making enough cards, as the site is fairly new. I currently have a payout of $820.00. As, I have been using this for quite a while.

They have also attempted to have the card used fairly similar to PayPal, to where you can buy things from many online E-commerce sites, such as Ebay, Amazon, and other online shopping centers.[/url][/quote]

I guess that explains for the card contest thing they have going on.

Read full topic
